dublin_core.dcvalue: By analyzing self reports from sample of 91 college students from the United States who are frequent drivers the present study examined the prevalence of text messaging or texting while driving and the incidence of recklessness and consequences that accompany this behavior Analyses revealed that 91 of participants reported having used text messaging while driving with many reporting doing so with passengers including children riding in their vehicles Further a substantial number of participants reported driving dangerously above the speed limit and drifting into other traffic lanes while texting and many reported sexting and arguing via text messages while driving However these young drivers agreed that texting while driving is dangerous and should be illegal These results and the limitations to the present study are discussed
College students' prevalence and perceptions of text messaging while driving.
